snippet: Polls suggested that President Jacob Zuma’s African National Congress will steamroll to victory, but with less support than in the past.
abstract: Voters cast ballots across South Africa following campaign season that betrayed cracks in the governing African National Congress party and hinted at realignment of nation's politics in years ahead; polls indicate that ANC will maintain power despite corruption scandals, but with fewer votes than in the past.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Polls suggested that President Jacob Zuma’s African National Congress will steamroll to victory, but with less support than in the past.

headline.main: South Africans Vote as Zuma Seeks Second Term as President
headline.print_headline: South Africans Vote After Campaign That Put Leaders’ Troubles on Display
